subject: Re: how to transcribe air and ear
msgSnippet: ... Why wouldn t we want to use IPA? it is very precise. There are other pronounciation keys,  such as the ones used in American dictionaries, but they
messageBody:
--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, Terry Smithwick <Tinyallen@...>
wrote:
>
> Here's a question. How does IPA describe it's sound
> symbols?
> Perhaps we could use a variation of their method?
>

Why wouldn't we want to use IPA? it is very precise. There are other
pronounciation keys, such as the ones used in American dictionaries,
but they wouldn't allow us to have the precise conversation we are now
having.

Paul
